column4: how is it possible a disk is mounted (rw), but still a "read-only filesystem"? ;x
cant even boot up my feisty anymore because of that
glad if i can get any hints :(
it is mounted, i'm in text (recovery) mode atm
i dunno.  you in text mode now?
not too sure myself.  have you edited /etc/fstab recently?
and it's done this every time you've tried to boot into this kernel?
perhaps it's a bug in the kernel.  do you have any other kernel entries in your GRUB menu that you can boot into?
can you get the exact error that's produced when you boot?
it just hangs, after executing all the rc6 scripts with start
then x doesnt come up, and init seems dead
i'm not sure what's going on man.
try booting into a livecd, chrooting and updating.
